description: A structure for defining what the input of an end point should look like.

name.description: The name of the Input Entity Definition.  Since these are typically used between multiple HTTP methods you should include the method names in the name.  For example, 'ShoppingCartGetDelete'.

description.description: The client facing documentation on what this field does.

fieldDefinitions.description: The collection of fields that make up this Input Entity Definition record

httpMethods.description: The HTTP method(s) that this field applies to.  Typically a portion of a payload for an end point will apply to multiple Http methods.  For example, GET and DELETE payloads are similar, as are POST and PATCH payloads.

requiredMethods.description: The HTTP method(s) that this field is required for.  Similar to the httpMethod property, there is usually overlap in a field's requiredness based on HTTP method.

source.description: Where the value should be obtained from on the HTTP request
